alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Douglas; Ferry; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 01 at 1:11PM PDT until June 03 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Slow moving thunderstorms will develop Thursday afternoon across north-central Washington and continue through Thursday evening. Heavy rain with thunderstorms will be a concern for flash flooding or debris flows within and below recent burn scars. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over recent burn scars. * WHERE...Portions of North Central and Northeast Washington, including the following counties, in North Central Washington, Chelan, Douglas and Okanogan. In Northeast Washington, Ferry. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over recent burn scars is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near a burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over burn scars across north-central Washington, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
